title: Cocycles with Quasi-Conformality I: Stability and prevalence
authors: Meysam Nassiri, Hesam Rajabzadeh and Zahra Reshadat
abstract:
This is the first part of a series of papers devoted to the study of linear
cocycles over chaotic systems. In the present paper, we show that every
$\mathrm{SL}(d,\mathbb{R})$ cocycle over a shift of finite type either admits a
dominated splitting or is $\mathcal{C}^0$-approximated by a cocycle that
$\mathcal{C}^\alpha$-stably exhibits bounded orbits ($\alpha>0$). The proof is
based on a new mechanism which yields stable elliptic-type behavior in
arbitrary dimensions.
